strings.Value: "Sleeping in a tent isn't that bad. It depends who you're sharing it with..."
"I think we've fought enough to deserve a little comfort."
"Yes, it's wonderful finally getting a place to call home. All one can wish now is to have a family to go with it..."

{n}The soldiers fall out, and only Kjerdi Eisbock remains, looking as gloomy as ever despite the universal jubilation. The sullen dwarf is quartermaster and chaplain of the {g|Varnling Host}Varnling Host{/g}, famous for her skill in dampening the commander's enthusiasm.{/n}
"Welcome back, your grace. Did you have fun at the celebration? Have enough to eat? Good, then let's get back to work before you squander the whole barony!"
"You should have gone with us. You would have liked it!"

"I hate {g|Restov}Restov{/g}. Besides, while you were at the ball, another bandit gang slithered into town. – And who would have taken care of it if I weren't here, hunh? Anyhow, the festivities are over. You're a baron now – get to baroning!"

"If you say so. To baroning! Here's my first order. I shall appoint you, Kjerdi, as Treasurer. You, {d|Cephal}Cephal{/d}, will be my Regent, and you, {Name}, my General. Any questions? No? Then get to work!"

"Well, General, here's your first order. Talk to Kjerdi and pick three of our lads as your brothers in arms. I can't spare more than three for now. – Someone has to guard the capital! Take the best, whoever will follow you to hell and back! When you've gathered them together, come find me at the fort. There's something I need you to do."

{n}For a few moments, Maegar watches Cephal and Kjerdi go away, then looks at you. There's a mischievous twinkle in his eyes.{/n} "Hard to believe, isn't it? After so many years of life on the road, nights in barracks and tents, I am now a baron – with my own humble baronial residence."
"That's my most loyal companion! – No idle talk, right to business." {n}Maegar chuckles, though he looks a little disappointed that you didn't continue the conversation.{/n}
"Right! Well, we'll try to get used to soft feather-beds, warmth, and a roof over our heads that doesn't leak!"
{n}Maegar smiles.{/n} "You're right. Anyway, we'll have plenty of time to discuss the respective merits of tents and beds, ha ha!"

{n}Maegar looks down and smiles faintly for a moment.{/n} "Yes. Because who needs an empty house, where your only companion is an echo? Well, our best days are still ahead..." {n}He becomes silent and grows pensive.{/n}
